DataElement.preferredName: Patient Tissue Specimen Colorectal Research Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether permission has been obtained from a person, who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, to use a bit of tissue or blood or urine for research purposes related to diseases of the colon or the rectum.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Tissue Specimen Colorectal Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to permission from a person, who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, to use a bit of tissue or blood or urine for research purposes related to diseases of the colon or the rectum.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:(ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has given permission
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store snap frozen tissue for future research of colorectal cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did this patient provide written conset to give Snap Frozen specimen(s) fo research
